subject: Re: [junit] Unit Testing JPD's (Weblogic Java Process Definitions)
msgSnippet: If I were to interpret your question...are you asking whether there are any test wrappers available that is something like JPDTestcase serving as a JPD client
messageBody:
If I were to interpret your question...are you asking whether there are any
test wrappers available that is something like JPDTestcase serving as a JPD
client similar to ServletTestCase(Cactus) serving as a EJB client? If yes,
then the answer is no (at least I don't know of).

But if you want to test JPD can you create a JPD Application deploy it on
the server, create a JPD proxy put it part of the client test code. Your
client test code can be based on vanilla JUnit.

Let me know if you want more details on this..

~JAK

On 4/14/06, Ritch Linklater <ritchlink@...> wrote:
>
> Does anyone know if JUNIT supports this or if there is another tool
> out there that might?
>
> Thanks
>
>
>
